titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Men's Basketball Poster Collection, 1959-2013 UA.01.15.0015
titlestmt.author: Tracy M. Jackson

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-02-17 14:11:37 UTC.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Basketball team posters are usually produced at the start of a new basketball season, depicting the season's team player lineup and sometimes the game schedule. The Men's Basketball Poster Collection is comprised of posters featuring the Duke Blue Devils Men's Basketball Team.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Men's Basketball Poster Collection was received by the University Archives from several sources: Jim Jarvis in 2015, multiple other sources.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Men's Basketball Poster Collection, University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by: Tracy M. Jackson, February 2015.
Accessions described in this finding aid: UA2015.0009, multiple other accessions.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Men's Basketball Poster Collection is comprised of posters featuring the Duke Blue Devils Men's Basketball Team. These posters typically depict the entire team posing for a photograph, sometimes with the team coach; several posters commemorate championship wins or the game results for the season, while a few feature only the Blue Devil or an illustration of some team members. Posters range in size from 12"x18" to 36"x48" with considerable individual variation in size. Posters collected by University Archives from a variety of sources are generally unsigned. Most posters donated by Jim Jarvis were autographed by the entire team and/or Coach Mike Krzyzewski and are mounted on foam core board.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: University Archives Poster Collection, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.
Men's Basketball Records, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.
Athletics Reference Collection, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.
Sports Information Office Records, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: Basketball was first played at Trinity College in 1906, introduced by then-Athletic Director Wilbur Wade Card. Since then, men's basketball has been played each year at Trinity College and later Duke University, appearing in the NCAA Tournament dozens of times, winning the national championship four times (in 1991, 1992, 2001, and 2010).

Prior to 1980, team posters depicting the Duke Blue Devils men's basketball team in uniform and listing the season's games were often created, as were special publicity and commemorative posters for tournaments, championships, and rivalry games. In 1980, Mike Krzyzewski (Coach K) became head coach of the team, taking over for Bill Foster. Shortly after his arrival, Coach K's wife, Carol "Mickie" Krzyzewski, began a traditional of creating a thematic poster for each season's team. Mrs. Krzyzewski, and later their daughter Debbie Krzyzewski, collaborated with graphic designer Jim Jarvis and others (including photographer Chris Hildreth) to create a new poster every year, using a variety of themes and styles. Basketball team posters are usually produced at the start of a new basketball season, depicting the season's team player lineup and sometimes the game schedule.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.
